info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 8:28PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Madison, northeastern Swain and northwestern Haywood Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 826 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles east of Gatlinburg, or 8 miles northeast of Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, Smoky Mountains-Cataloochee, Smoky Mountains-Balsam Mountain, Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, B.R. Parkway-Smoky Mountains To Balsam Gap, Smoky Mountains-Oconaluftee, Cherokee, Waterville, Fines Creek and Spring Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
